title: Electrolytes & Monitoring (QT-risk mitigation)
text:
- Guidelines commonly recommend keeping potassium in the higher end of normal to reduce QT-related arrhythmia risk.
- Practical target often cited in QT-risk pathways: **K = 4.0–5.0 mEq/L** (individualize to patient context and institutional policy).

title: Electrolytes & Monitoring (QT-risk mitigation)
text: - Correct hypomagnesemia; many QT-risk pathways aim for **Mg >= 2.0 mg/dL** (or high-normal), depending on local practice.

title: Electrolytes & Monitoring (QT-risk mitigation)
text:
- Repeat ECG after correcting electrolytes and/or changing QT-prolonging medications.
- Consider telemetry in higher-risk scenarios (e.g., QTc >= 500 ms, multiple QT-prolonging agents, symptoms, bradycardia, structural heart disease).

title: Electrolytes & Monitoring (QT-risk mitigation)
text: - These are decision-support targets; final decisions should follow local protocols and the treating clinician’s judgment.

title: QT / TdP Risk Checklist
text:
- QTc >= 500 ms
- Rapid QTc increase from baseline
- Low K and/or low Mg
- Multiple QT-prolonging agents
- Bradycardia
- Structural heart disease (e.g., CHF)
- Renal dysfunction raising drug exposure

title: QT / TdP Risk Checklist
text:
- Correct electrolytes first
- Review necessity of QT-prolonging agents and consider alternatives
- Repeat ECG after interventions

title: QTGuard Knowledge Base (Starter)
section: Required inputs for QT risk triage
text:
- QTc (ms)
- Potassium (K)
- Magnesium (Mg)
- Current medication list (with doses)
- Renal/hepatic function if available

title: QTGuard Knowledge Base (Starter)
text:
- QTc >= 500 ms or large delta increase from baseline
- Hypokalemia / hypomagnesemia
- Multiple QT-prolonging meds
- Bradycardia
- Structural heart disease
- Recent dose increases / drug interactions that raise concentrations

title: QTGuard Knowledge Base (Starter)
text:
- If QTc/K/Mg missing → safe deferral + request missing inputs
- If evidence does not support a claim → do not assert it; ask a follow-up question

title: Safety Guardrails for QTGuard Outputs
text:
- Do not recommend holding or discontinuing a medication unless the evidence supports it.
- Prefer: "consider holding" / "review necessity" / "consider alternative" when evidence is general.

title: Safety Guardrails for QTGuard Outputs
text: - If evidence is weak or key context is missing (dose, renal function, full med list), ask a targeted follow-up question.
